tn.text: The writer speaks of money that people would give Samuel's sons as if it were a person or animal running away from Samuel's sons, and he speaks of Samuel's sons as if they were physically chasing that person or animal. AT: "they worked hard to gain money by being dishonest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"judged in favor of those who did evil"

tn.ref: do not walk in your ways
tn.text: The way a person lives is spoken of as walking on a path. AT: "do not do the things you do" or "do not do what is just the way you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Appoint for us a king to judge us like all the nations
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "Appoint for us a king like the kings of all the nations so that he can judge us" or 2) "Appoint for us a king who will judge us the way the kings of the nations judge them"

tn.ref: Appoint for us a king to judge us
tn.text: The leaders wrongly believed that a king, and his sons after him, would rule justly.

tn.ref: But it displeased Samuel ... Give us a king to judge us
tn.text: Samuel was unhappy that the people did not just want him to remove his corrupt sons and to appoint honest judges, but they wanted a king to rule over them like other countries had.

tn.ref: Obey the voice of the people
tn.text: Here "the voice" is a metonym for the will or the desire of the people. AT: "Do what the people say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh knew that the people were not just rejecting corrupt judges, but they were rejecting Yahweh as their king.

tn.ref: I brought them out of Egypt
tn.text: This refers to Yahweh freeing the Israelites from slavery in Egypt many years before.
"Now do what they are asking you to do" (UDB)
"be very serious as you warn them"

tn.ref: This will be the practice ... He will take
tn.text: The practice of the king will be to take. This begins the list of things he will take.

tn.ref: This will be the practice of the king who will reign over you
tn.text: The abstract noun "practice" can be translated as a verb. AT: "This is how the king who will reign over you will act" or "This is what the king who will reign over you will do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"have them drive chariots in battle"
They will ride horses into battle.
Samuel continues to tell what things the king will take.
"to make good-smelling oils to put on his body"
"fields of olive trees"
They will have to divide their grain into ten equal parts and give one of those parts to the king's officers and servants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])

They will have to divide the wine that they produce in their vineyards into ten equal parts and give one of those parts to the king's officers and servants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])
These are the leaders of the king's army.
Samuel continues to tell what things the king will take.

They will have to divide their flocks into ten equal parts and give one of those parts to the king's officers and servants. See how you translated "tenth" in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:08:13|8:15]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])
"you will feel as if you are his slaves"
Possible meanings are 1) the people will ask Yahweh to rescue them from the king or 2) the people will ask the king to stop treating them so badly (UDB).

tn.ref: he repeated them in the ears of Yahweh
tn.text: Here the metonym "the ears of Yahweh" refers to Yahweh. Samuel prayed to Yahweh repeating all that the people said. AT: "he repeated them to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the metonym "their voice" refers to the will of the people.  AT: "Obey the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: cause someone to be king for them
tn.text: "make someone king over them." Use the common term in your language for making someone king.
"go home"
